plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning pale pink to white flowers that bloom profusely, typically heralding the arrival of spring in temperate regions. The blossoms are short-lived but spectacular, creating a breathtaking floral display.
plants.location: Japan, East Asia, and temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms symbolize the transient nature of life in Japanese culture, celebrated annually during Hanami festival.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with fragrant, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom abundantly in early spring through summer. Oleanders thrive in warm climates and are drought-tolerant, making them popular in Mediterranean and subtropical gardens.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern United States, and parts of South America
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, all parts of the oleander plant are highly toxic if ingested.

plants.name: Erythronium dens-canis
plants.description: A perennial spring wildflower that grows in woodland areas, featuring nodding, delicate flowers with mauve or pink petals and mottled leaves resembling a dog's tooth, hence its name.
plants.funFact: Erythronium bulbs were sometimes used as a starch substitute in famine times.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its fluffy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter and early spring. The flowers have a strong fragrance and appear in dense, spherical clusters.
plants.location: Australia and cultivated in Mediterranean climates worldwide
plants.funFact: The bright yellow flowers of Acacia dealbata are celebrated during International Women's Day in many countries, symbolizing respect and appreciation.
